item.description:
OK, last minute but I "need" the trail... A roughly 4 mile lower effort hike at Penwood State Park, where we will go out on the closed paved park road to Lake Louise and return on the abandoned semi-paved park road to make a loop. Some elevation gain, but nothing too difficult. Some views at Lake Louise. Plan to meet in the parking lot at Penwood. The hike should take about 2 hrs. and be done by about 3 PM.

Due to an injury, I am restricted for a little bit from my more interesting (crazy? ) hike selections. So, please join me on this recovery hike.

I don't think we will have any ice given the high temperatures but it wouldn't hurt to bring your Microspikes or other traction device just in case. Hiking boots or winter boots a must for this hike.

Kids can come on the hike. Pets on a leash are permitted on hiking trails.

 

Approximate location/directions (173 Hartford Rd. (Rte. 185), Simsbury, CT - drive in to get to parking lot on right):
http://www.mapquest.com/maps#bf22b06394bce9091131142b

Trail map:
http://www.ct.gov/dep/lib/dep/stateparks/maps/penwood.pdf

For more information on the Park:
http://www.ct.gov/dep/cwp/view.asp?a=2716&q=325248&depNav_GID=1650
